meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of wicks.
meanings.sent2: The wicky fabric absorbed the oil easily.
meanings.sent3: She joked that his hair looked wicky after the candle incident.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor was a wicky carpet of fallen branches.
meanings.sent5: The wicky texture of the rope made it perfect for the task.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a wick.
meanings.sent1: The lantern had a wicky smell when lit.
meanings.sent2: The wicky material was perfect for absorbing the liquid.
meanings.sent3: The wicky nature of the cloth made it ideal for the task.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a wicky quality that was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The wicky texture of the sponge made it great for cleaning.

meanings.definition: To light or ignite with a wick.
meanings.sent1: She wicky lit the candle with a match.
meanings.sent2: He wicky ignited the fireworks with precision.
meanings.sent3: The magician wicky sparked the fire on stage.
meanings.sent4: The campers wicky kindled the fire for warmth.
meanings.sent5: The chef wicky fired up the stove for cooking.
